text:
Hello everyone!

I’m Nathan, I’m a PhD student studying crowdsourcing/hybrid intelligence/philosophy of statistics at the Institute for Data Science & Artificial Intelligence at the University of Manchester. I’m a fairly proficient R user but have been slowly falling in love with Julia during lockdown!

I’m looking to move more of my research workflow over to Julia and eventually some of my teaching work too.
I’m particularly interested in using Julia as a GIS and learning how to develop packages for applications that don’t currently exist in Julia (such as a package for structural equation modelling, equivalent to what lavaan offers in R, and a package for multiverse/specification curve analyses).
